text: The setting sun backlights a series of abstract colored i images of STAINED GLASS and lead. FOOTSTEPS ECHO across the marble floor.

A little older, a little wiser, yet still very pretty, no she's all alone in the house of the Lord. And those doleful eyes of hers clearly telegraph a very h still rests upon her soul. She reluctantly walks past the rows of empty pews toward CONFESSIONAL BOOTH.
Julie slides the drapes shut behind her as she enters, kn the CLOSED SCREEN. A beat -- and the SCREEN SLIDES OPEN.
enters the adjacent booth -- barely visible through the W Julie looks down, crosses herself, and begins.
Bless me, Father, for I have sinned. (a beat) It's been a year since my last confession...

Julie swallows hard. This is difficult for her. JULIE (cont'd) I've never told anyone this. Not my mom, not the poice, not even my friends -- except for the ones who were there and they...well they're not around anymore. You see I...I...
Yes?
I killed a man. Well, I thought I had...then...

She balks at the memory of it. The priest bows his head i of the other side. JULIE (cont'd) (emotional) You've got to understand...It was all an accident. A terrible accident. It's been a whole year. I've tried to get past this, but I just can't.
Go on...
I have these dreams...horrible dreams. And this man is always there with me.
(reassuring) I know...

You see, he was a killer. He murdered Helen and Barry, and he would have killed me too, if I hadn't...gotten away with it. (regathering) I don't know, I guess I just need to deal with the fear, the guilt...to finally say his name. Ben Willis. His name was Ben Willis...
The confession is cathartic for Julie. She looks relieved
I know...
Julie stops. Looks through the screen. A chill shoots thr body.
You know? But how could you...
Clouds of icy steam shoot through the partition. Julie mo the screen, trying to get a better look.
(growls) I KNOW WHAT YOU DID LAST SUMMER!!!
smashes through the screen right in Julie's face! She SCR

Still screaming -- Julie jumps back, seemingly knocked ou chair. She fights the unseen demon. Sitting beside her, Julie's friend WILL BENSON reacts. He looking kid in a shy, humble kind of way. And he tries to but she's too busy turning ten shades of red. The PROFESSOR lowers his glasses, makes it even worse.
Nice to see you find Political Science so stimulating --
The lecture hall erupts with laughter.
I'm sorry --
Julie grabs her stuff and bolts.
Julie explodes out of the building. Hurries down a sidewa finally catches up.
Julie! Wait! You okay?
I'm fine.
You sure?
I'm fine.
You don't seem fine.
Julie realizes this is true.
I had another dream, Will.
Will takes this seriously.
The shower again?
It was in a church...it was so real. I mean, I could feel his breath on me.
(caring) I'm sorry.
I thought I was over the dreams for good. I really did. I hadn't had one for months.
It just takes time, Julie. It's gonna get better.
It can't get worse. I mean, it's not like this was the first time I freaked out in class. I hardly ever get a full night's sleep, my grades suck, I'm this close from being thrown out of school.
BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! EXPLOSIONS. Julie jumps out of her skin STUDENTS letting off FIRECRACKERS as they fly past on bic Will and Julie are now thinking the same thing.
(cont'd) It was one year ago...
It's...the anniversary. That's what's going on...Take it easy on yourself.
(weary) I'm trying. I really am...Sometimes I don't even know why I came up here in the first place.
(cheering her up) To get out of Southport?
(softens) Right. Now I remember.
He smiles at her. She smiles back. They stop in front of building. JULIE (cont'd) Are you getting out of town on the fourth?
Nah. I'll probably just be here studying for finals. The joys of summer school... (beat) Are you okay?
I'm okay.
Are you sure?
She touches his face affectionately.
Thanks for the talk, Will. You're good to me.
Will stands there akwardly --
Um...Okay. Bye.
Will walks away. Julie watches him a beat, then turns dow
steps out of the shadows. Julie practically faints.
Oh, my god, Ray. You scared me.
Recovering, she hugs Ray, genuinely glad to see him. He's
I got in early. I was excited... (re: the receding Will) Who was that guy?
Oh, that's Will. He's a friend. You'd like him.
Yeah.
Ray, we're just friend.
Every guy in history who tried to pick up a girl did the good-friend thing first.
Why are you being like this?
It should be obvious Ray feels insecure in the college en they're miscommunicating.

Hey, I'm sorry. You're right. Are you ready to go? I've got the old truck. You know the drill...Crab boil at Ollie's. Croaker Queen Pageant...It's only small-town fun, but it's still nice. People really miss you. I miss you.
She looks at Ray, his compassionate demeanor. This is har
(softly, but resolved) Ray, I can't...
Can't what?
I just feel like some part of me hasn't healed up enough to go back. Like some critical piece is missing. Please understand...
Ray is cold. This is what he's expected all along.
I understand something.
It's not like that. It's not you. It's me. My head. I want to go back. I want to be with you. I want to be fine. I want everything to be like it used to be. (beat) It just isn't.
Ray is hurt and confused. JULIE (cont'd) Hey, why don't you stay up here? They have fireworks over the river. And...there's a million things to do.
I have to work, Julie. My boat's in Southport, remember? But, I get it. You need your space from Craokerland. And maybe from me, too.
Ray starts walking away. RAY (cont'd) You know where to find me.
Ray? Ray? At least come up for a while.
Ray keeps on walking.
It's okay. I'm just gonna go.
Julie follows him out to the road. A group of LAUGHING ST her way.
Ray, I'm sorry. I didn't mean... (to herself) I'm just scared...that's all.
But Ray is already gone. Julie stares after him a beat, t quickly to her door. She clearly feels uncomfortable, exp walk alone. She nervously pulls her keys. A can of mace d the keychain.

Students throw FRISBEE in the street. Ray walks to his ol which is wedged between a new Sport Utility and a BMW. He clambers into the front seat. He thinks. Then, digs in and pulls out the unmistakable shape of an ENGAGEMENT RIN throws it in the glove box, starts the truck and drives a
Julie opens the door and steps inside. She locks three de stands there, alone, listening to the SILENCE. She doesn' cat. A faucet DRIPS in the kitchen.

The faucet DRIPS. Julie turns the handle. No success. She lock on each window. She stands for a moment. She picks up a bag of chips and eats a handful. She opens and takes out a can of nacho cheese sauce. She grabs a so a jar of bread-and-butter pickles. She gets some cookies She thinks. Opens the freezer, pulls out some fat-free so She takes the whole mess toward her bedroom.

She hits the light switch. A bedside light goes on. It's furnished room. The bed is pilled high with pillows. She windows, then climbs into bed with the food. On the bedside table are pictures of family and friends. one of Helen and Barry. She looks around the room. It's d Outside we hear young people having fun, slamming car doo places. She picks at the food, then puts it on the table. off the bedside light and enjoys the golden late afternoo room.

Julie, sound asleep, is curled into fetal position on the There's a CLICK in the front hall. And ANOTHER. Julie's eyes shoot open. She listens. Another SOUND, almo front door being CLOSED. Her arm reaches for the bedside light. She hits the switc POPS.
(whispers) Okay. Okay. Face your fears...
She gets off the bed and stands still. JULIE (cont'd) (whisper) There's nothing...
There's another NOISE down the hall. JULIE (cont'd) (whisper) Quiet.
Julie silently scoots out of her bedroom toward the kitch
She gets a large KNIFE. She listens. It sounds like somon living room. She steps through the kitchen door. As she moves we see a shadow pass the other way down the toward her bedroom.
There's NO ONE there. JULIE (cont'd) Okay, calm down, imagination.
She relaxes until she sees that her front door is slightl from the hallway slanting through. JULIE (cont'd) I can't take this anymore. I can't.
Holding the knife in front of her, she tiptoes to the hal a soft RUSTLING coning from her bedroom. She gets a flash a drawer and starts down the hallway. JULIE (cont'd) (fatalistic) Let's just do it.
She moves faster toward her bedroom. she listens outside It sounds like someone's in the closet. She moves into th
There's a noise in the darkened closet. Julie moves into She turns the flashlight ON and lunges for the closet.
KARLA WILSON, 19, all grace and attitude, is on tiptoes r box of shoes. She SCREAMS. Julie SCREAMS. They both SCREAM together. Julie drops the flashlight.
I thought you were out of town!
What are you doing in my closet?
They hug, jumping up and down with relief.
I thought you were out of town!
What are you doing in my closet?
i just wanted your black pants, but I'm not ready to die for them!
Julie turns on the light in the hallway. Karla has her sh hand and black pants draped over her arm.
That was heart attack time, Karla.
No. When I put these skinny pants on my body...Now, that's heart attack time.
Karla looks down and sees the knife. She picks it up with fingers -- KARLA (cont'd) And we're going to put away the utensils and you're coming with me.
Julie flops down on her bed.
I'm not going anywhere. I'm fat, ugly, and depressed.
Yeah, right -- whatever.
I think I just really hurt Ray's feelings.
(keeping it upbeat) Listen to me, Julie. Ray's a great guy, nothing against old Ray, but he's so...Ray. I mean, he lives in Southport. Will's a nice guy, too, and he lives right down the street.
Karla picks up the flashlight and goes into the closet.
There's nothing between Will and me.
Yet. Nothing yet.
She emerges with clothes for Julie. Holds up one outfit. KARLA (cont'd) What we gotta do is keep moving. No time to mope. I'm working at the club tonight. And you, dancing queen, are coming with me.
No I'm not.
Karla holds up another dress for Julie -- strapless, sexy
Fine, then be fat, ugly, and depressed.
Karla is dancing around. Julie laughs at her friend and t dress when Karla hands it to her.
It's a hopping college joint: crowded, loud MUSIC, a danc rivers of cheap booze.
Julie sits next to Karla as she waits for her drink order A handsome young man slides in front of them. This is TYR 23, handsome, no pretention, a little dangerous, with a k
You know what I want to do to you ...right now, don't you? There's gotta be somewhere we can be alone.
(playful) I don't think so. It's pretty crowded.
Just for a minute, baby. I got something I wanna tell you.
He's looking for a dark corner or a storeroom or somethin
(teasing) If you can say all you gotta say in a minute then I don't wanna hear it.
I'll talk real slow.
He's kissing her ear. She starts to giggle. The bartender sets down drinks on Karla's tray.
(re: Julie) Ask her to dance.
Tyrell hesitates. KARLA (cont'd) Go on.
Karla cuts away through the crowd, delivering drinks. Tyr Julie.
You're the most beautiful woman in the bar tonight, Jules.
Tyrell, you are an unstoppable force of nature.
That's right. It's how the species survives. You'll never convince me otherwise. (beat) Wanna dance?
Karla passes by --
Say yes.
No.
No means yes.
Tyrell, I appreciate it, but have you seen my people dance? We make the mouth face, we move the fingers --
(heading for the floor) Worse comes to worse, you can stand there and watch me.
Come on, I'll take a break and we'll all dance.

is packed and thumping. Karla is dancing her way through Tyrell and Julie follow behind her. Karla sees Will. He's dressed up and nervous. She smiles. KARLA (cont'd) Whaddayou know? Will Benson lookin' fine.
(suspicious, but having fun) Karla! Did you tell him I'd be here?
Nope. I told him that you absolutely, positively would not be here at this bar between ten o'clock and eleven o'clock tonight. And then he came anyway.
(shy to a fault) This was not my idea.
What?
I said, this...Do you want a drink?
Will looks down at his feet. He and Julie stand there not knowing what to do.
Where I come from, you want to snatch the goodies, you got to at least talk to them first.
Tyrell and Karla go for it on the dance floor, leaving Wi alone. They look at each other. They look at everyone dan
How about a drink?
Will is a few steps ahead as they move for the bar. Julie relaxing, having a good time. Then, she looks up into the sees, in a strobe light's FLASH --
watching her intently. She squints for a better look, but
(yelling over the din) You okay?
She's chalk white and crestfallen. Her whole affect is "W have a normal time?" She drifts amay toward the stairs to WILL (cont'd) Hey Julie?
Will catches Karla and Tyrell's eyes. They're worried.
Julie catches another glimps of THE SLICKER. She pushes her way through the crowd up the stairs.

Julie looks all around -- finally spotting the MAN IN THE behind, making his way to the other side. He slices through a crowd of students, and Julie keeps fo turns down a service corridor. Julie follows, frightened, but unable to resist. She catches him at the end of the corridor. She reaches o the stranger's arm.
Ben...
The stranger turns around. It's only a club kid in a tack raincoat and hat. She's shaken.
Hye, baby. You following me up here? (a come-on) Well, all right.
Julie turns away and hurries down the hallway. Todd follo figure quickly fades.
With morning sun filtering through her blinds, Julie wake strange sound of THUMPING. She gets out of bed and slowly room.
The noise gets louder as she heads down the hall.
The noise is at its loudest -- Julie reaches for a doorkn yanks open the door.
rocking and banging inside the closet. Julie frowns. Julie spins, once again startled by Karla, who crosses to flipping open the lid and then jumping back to catch the pop out on the fly.
(still sleepy) That could break the machine.
Julie, people who end up making rules like that end up beating their kids with wire hangers. It's a fact.
The phone RINGS. Karla looks at her watch. KARLA (cont'd) It's Tyrell.
(resigned) The number's unlisted...
Would you relax? We've been dating three months. He ain't stalking your butt.
Okay, okay. You're right.
I know it, and it feels good. (answering the phone) Hi, Ty.
A DJ for a local radio station BOOMS from the phone.
This is Mark in the Morning for Magic 96.7 Radio Station! Who am I speaking with?
Julie watches her friend get excited.
Mark in the Morning! Magic 96.7! Oh my God! I'm Karla. Karla Wilson. (to Julie) Jules, it's Mark in the Morning.
Well, Karla, what're you doin' at home over the long fourth weekend?
Well, I'm in school and --
How'd you like to win a Magic 96.7 Quicky Getaway?
Yes!
Julie hits the SPEAKERPHONE BUTTON and Karla hangs up. Th echos through the appartment.
Good, then I hope you remember your geography, Karla, because all you have to do to win is tell me the capital of Brazil.
Karla's smile abruptly fades.
(into phone) Brazil? Um...
She looks to Julie, whose face is as blank as hers. KARLA (cont'd) You don't know?! You have to know. You know everything...
C'mon, Karla, one easy question, one great getaway!
(shrugs) ...South America...Carnival...
Karla, we need an answer. No looking it up.
Still here...thinking... (stalling) You mean Brazil, the country?
Okay, Karla, five seconds. (counting down) Five...Four...
Julie has an idea. She scramles for the kitchen. Grabs a GROUND COFFEE from the FREEZER. MARK (cont'd, V.O.) Three...Two...
Julie tosses the bag across the room to Karla. Karla read RIO BLEND -- 100% BRAZILIAN COFFEE.
(blurting) Rio de Janeiro!
Oh, no...Did you say Rio?
(wincing) No. Yes?
BELLS and WHISTLES and triumphant MUSIC.
You just won Magic 96.7's Quickie Getaway...a trip for four to Tower Bay Island in the fabulous Bahamas.
Karla and Julie jump up and down ecstatically.
Waaaaahhhhhhhhhh!
We'll call you back with all the details...So what's your favorite radio station?
Magic 96.7!
Julie hangs up and joins Karla dancing on the couch.

I won. I won...I won, I won, I won. (teasing) Now, let's see...There's Tyrell, that's one. And, there's my parents ...And I got some cousins. (beat) Okay, Julie, you can come, but Mark said four tickets. That means you gotta get yourself a date.
Julie thinks, she seems torn.

A SMALL MOUND OF RED SNAPPER is DUMPED -- wiggling and su way across the deck of a fishing boat. WE PULL AWAY TO REVEAL it's RAY who's just done the dumpi coworker, DAVE, friendly, playful, and down-to-earth, cal the dock --
Hey, Ray...phone!
Ray takes the phone. WE INTERCUT.
Hi.
Ray is happy to hear her voice, but cautious.
(beat) Hey. I'm really glad you called... I'm sorry.
(compassoinate) No, you don't have to be sorry. I'm the one --
No, I shouldn't have left so fast... I was just...
It's okay.
Dave holds up two wriggling snappers. He dances them towa in a puppetlike mating ritual, making KISSING SOUNDS and

(as the fish) Julie, I love you. I know I'm only a humble fish, but if you really look at it, you're a fish, too. (girl voice) Oh, Ray, you're right...Do me like a snapper. (mashing the fish together) Hey, something smells like fish...
Ray waves him away, concentrating on his call.
Ray, Karla won a trip to the Bahamas! An island called Tower Bay. And she wants us to come with her.
What? The Bahamas? You're kidding.
Dave's interest is piqued.
We'd have a long weekend just to sit in the sun, drink fruity drinks, and swim, and... (sexy) You know...
This weekend?
Dave is watching Ray closely. Ray's expression hardens.
(hurt) You'll go away with you're college friends, but you won't go away with me?
Idiot. Idiot. Idiot.
Karla is watching Julie.
It's not you, it's Southport. And it's the Bahamas! And it's free!
Karla is watching Julie.
You gotta sell his butt on the Bahamas?
Ray, come on. I want us to be together.
Ray thinks. Dave looks at him like he's crazy.
(can't give in) Julie, we're working a big run up here. It's been crazy. We probably have to go out again tonight. I don't think I can do it.
Will you try...for me, please?
Dave moves one of the fish like it's been shot through th
Okay, I'll try. But, listen... (martyrlike) If I don't make it up, then you go ahead and have a great time.
Ray...please try. I really miss you. (beat) Okay. Bye.
She hangs up and Karla sits next to her.
That boy has got fish on the brain. (sensitive) Hey, cheer up, Charlie. (singing a rumba) We're going to the Bahamas. Bahama Mama, yeah...
Ray is staring unhappily at the little pile of snapper. D staring at him in disbelief.

Man, what is your problem? We haven't caught anything for days. Pull the big ugly stick out of your butt. She asked you to go to the Bahamas! Man, you gotta go. We'll both drive up. I got friends I can see up there.
Ray realizes how right he is.
Stupid. Stupid.
Stupid. What were you thinkng?
Ray looks at Dave a contemplative beat, then walks over t He leans in the passenger side and pulls out the engageme Dave walks over.
You wanna see what I've been thinking?
He holds up the box and slowly opens it. Dave is stunned.
Jeez, Ray, fourth and forty, throw the bomb.
I should go up there. I should call her back, tell her I'm coming.
No way, man. Surprise her. She'll be psyched.
Ray is excited by the plan and Dave's right there with hi
We stare out at a rain-soaked stretch of road. A PICKUP ROARS past, cruising along with its RADIO loud a rolled down.
The music's even LOUDER in here. The mood is high...Two b to propose to a girl. Dave adjusts the radio to another A
Man, I love AM radio. You got right-wing conspiracy, tips for pregnant womem, Single-A baseball games, and real country music... None of that new crap...

He adjusts the dial again, tuning in a country song, "MAM YOUR BABIES GROW UP TO BE COWBOYS," by Waylon Jennings an Nelson. Dave starts singing along, extra LOUD and out of tune. DAVE (cont'd) (singing) "...Mamas, don't let your babies grow up to be cowboys, don't let 'em pick guitars and drive them old trucks. Let 'em be doctors and lawyers and such."
Ray looks at his goofy friend singing and starts to get a himself... Then, Ray sees something in the road ahead. He turns down They both stare --
its HAZARDS blinking. Ray slows and creeps past the car. The driver's door is o appears EMPTY.
is sprawled out in the road away from the car. Ray pulls shoulder and stops.
(nervous) I don't know, man. Maybe we should keep going, find a phone --
No.
The guy looks dead.
Ray has seen this before --
Maybe not.
He throws open his door.
Ray steps from his truck. Looks back at the empty car, th toward the body.
(nervous) Hey! Buddy, what's up?
The body doesn't move.
and behind Dave, in the other car, a FIGURE IN A SLICKER the back seat and gets out of the car. Ray continues toward the body.
Ray moves closer to the all to familiar image.
SLICKER FIGURE moves toward the unsuspecting Dave.
Dave watches Ray in the road. He leans across the seat an Ray's window. Behind him, the SLICKER FIGURE gets closer, moving to the side of the truck.
Ray nears the body. He kneels down.
Hey, can you hear me?
Ray reaches toward the body...
Something FLASHES IN THE SIDE-VIEW MIRROR.
Ray turns over the body. Something isn't right. Ray jumps
Its eerie smile mocking Ray who turns for the truck.
DAVE!
Dave hears something. He turns to late. SPLLAATTT!!! THE jams his hook through Dave's jaw and skull and YANKS DAVE CAR WINDOW.
...Dave?

There's no answer from dead Dave. Ray tries to see around headlights. He moves slowly toward the truck. The BRIGHTS and FOGS come on, blinding Ray. The truck's e The truck rolls a few inches, adjusting a bead on Ray. Then, tires spinning, the truck launches straight at Ray. Ray runs at the truck. AT THE LAST MINUTE, he ducks behin car. HIS TRUCK goes SCREAMING past. Ray backs around the car --
goes barreling by in the other direction. Ray dives out o
Ray is exposed. He sees his truck closing fast. He's got go. Then, at the very last second,
jumps off the edge of the road. His TRUCK SLAMS INTO THE

head_text.subj: WHERE RAY WAS STANDING. SPARKS FLY

text: Ray falls through the air. Lands hard on his leg. Tumbles hill, finally stopping with a crash. He lies motionless a of a ravine.
Karla exits the building. She watches Julie sitting on th A truck turns onto the street. Julie looks hopeful, but - Ray. Karla approaches her friend.
Girl, it's gettin' down to the wire.
Julie turns.
He's not coming. I thought he was just...
Julie, you left four messages... Four.
But, he said he'd try.
He said he'd try. Try is like maybe. Try is nothing!
(appoligizing for him) He does work hard.
Work hard, huh? He's breaking your heart just because he can. (hesitant) And I don't want to have to say I told you so...
Then, don't.
A Jeep Cherokee stops, and an ebullient Tyrell steps out shorts and a Hawaiian shirt.
Hey, baby, we gonna get tropical or we gonna get tropical?
The passenger door opens and Will Benson steps hesitantly Jeep.
Oh!
(re: Will) Hey, sorry... (quick, playing it off) He's my friend, too. And that ticket is not going to waste.
Will reads Julie's expression.
Julie, is everything cool? Karla said...
I said we start having fun. And that means now.
Julie takes a last look up the street. She stands.
Is there a problem here?
Where there's a Will, there's a way. Come on.
(deciding) You know what? This rocks. We're going to the Bahamas!
Will is relieved.
(getting into the spirit) We goin' Bahamas, I'm Ty's Bahama Mama. We goin' Bahamas...
She bops over to Tyrell.
A wide-body jet SCREAMS through the clouds.
A nearly empty jet. Karla has her head on Tyrell's should reading a book. Will's knuckles are white from gripping the armrests in f eyes are clenched shut. Julie looks on with concern.
Just take deep breaths and think of something happy from childhood.

What if I don't have anything happy from childhood...Sorry, I can't relax going five hundred miles an hour, or four thousand, four hundred feet a minute... (calculating) Which is over seven hundred feet a second. Imagine hitting something at seven hundred feet a second.
Deep breaths --

(no deep breaths) Fumes build up in the fuel tanks. You can by surface-to-air missiles over the internet. Planes use O-rings...which freeze in tap water. Planes fall from the sky for practically no reason at all.
You've got a better chance of getting hit by lightning.
Right. Planes get hit by lightning. They get hit by meteors. They hit other planes.
Tyrell shakes his head.
(exasperated) Something is gonna hit your butt if you don't quit complaining.
(sypathetic) Honey, some folks just can't fly.
Will doesn't move, frozen with fear of flying, but more c with the concerned Julie.
Establishing. A Board of Tourism kind of shot. Blue water islands. Golden sun. Puffy clouds. A BOAT CHUGS by with the words "Tower Bay" painted on the Tyrell THROWS UP over the side.
More of a small tub than a ferry. Julie, Karla, Will, and the only passengers. At the bow, Julie and Karla laugh and play "King of the W in the prow, Karla behind her.
(deadpan) I'm the King of the World.
(deadpan) No, I'm the King of the World.
They switch places. They look at each other and crack up Karla takes in the surroundings, the salt spray, the day
Remind me to study real hard so someday this is normal and all that back there is somethin' I do for a weekend once every ten years.
(sharing the moment) I will, and you remind me of the same thing.
They throws their arms around each other and stare into t
Will talks to a very green Tyrell.
You just gotta breathe.
Tyrell is trying to keep from puking --
Can't talk right now.
(slightly malicious) See, it's not a macho thing. It's about equilibrium in your inner ear. You could've used a patch, but it's too late now. Get used to it. (then) Some folks just can't sail.
PAULSEN, the BOAT CAPTAIN, overhears as he passes --
That's too bad, too, because it's the only way on or off the island. (slightly ominous) Unless you have an accident. And then they call the Coast Guard.
Julie and Karla have rejoined the men.
It's pretty remote here.
(smiles) Yep. That's what the tourists pay for -- sun, sea, and solitude.
Are we there yet?
Few more minutes.
We move off the boat and REVEAL the island. The intrepid excitedly take in the island.
Establishing. An isolated tropical paradise with jungle g beach.
The ferry pulls in to a canopied dock. A white-sand beach every direction. Beautiful tourists stroll about without world. Tyrell stamps his feet on the dock.
I feel like I'm still on that thing.
A dockhand, DERRICK, glides past him toward the ladies.
That way for a complimentary Planter's Punch to get you readjusted.
(mile-wide smile) I can get used to this.
Derrick reaches for Julie's hand, clearly checking her ou process.
Welcome, Fair Princess, to Tower Bay. (a wink) I'm Derrick. At your service for the duration of your stay.
Julie smiles politely. Will gently nudges her on. They wa
(to Derrick, mocking) I'm at your service, Princess.
(shrugs) Season's over old man. So I gotta work fast.
If Marine Radio's right about the weather, you're already out of time.
He hangs a SIGN at the end of the gangplank. It reads: LA FERRY -- LINE FORMS HERE. Our guys are already at the end of the dock.

Establishing. An opulent, Carribean-style hacienda resort accoutrements. The main building is two stories high with a tiled roof. rises from one side. And, of course, it is surounded on a suffocating fooliage. Julie and Karla take in the beauty of the resort.
Check it out.
catch the eyes of Tyrell and Will.
Yes, ma'am.

Karla THWACKS him on the back of the head, but they're al The path widens. The trees part. It's even nicer up close across a tiled plaza. Behind them, THREE YOUNG GUYS carry their GIRLFRIENDS pig racing each other toward the departure dock. Our two arriving couples move on toward the entrace, pass TENNIS COURT on the left. A GLASS-PANED ORCHID HOUSE stra And, on the right, A LUSH POOL with a built-in JACUZZI in the shallow end. A THATCHED ROOF BAR stands nearby -- and just beyonk it, a HOUSE. Julie smiles at her friend bravado. She steps over to a s and starts her workout.
Will and Tyrell step out of the room into the long, empty They cross to a balcony overlooking the lobby. The whole deserted.
Where is everybody?
(gallows humor) They're all dead...Dead, I tell you. (ghostly) Ahhhh, we're all deaaaddddd. Tyrellll, joinnnn usss.
Will's voice echoes across the lobby. Tyrell is maybe a l nervous, but hiding it.
Shut up.
They walk down the steps to the lobby.
They cross the lobby.
(calling out) Hello? (worried) There's nobody here, Tyrell.
Tyrell's already out the front entrance.
Will and Tyrell exit the hotel and make their way down th outside and go splashing across the flooded grounds. Debr storm is scattered all around them.
They're around...They just don't care about us 'cause we're the contest winners. (beat) Let's go find Stoner Boy...Make his lazy butt hook us up with fishing poles or Ping-Pong paddles or something.
(nervous) You know, the greenhouse effect has caused the gulf stream to shift and almost every meteorological expert expects a dramatic increase in tropical depression --
Hey -- shut up, okay?
Tyrell keeps walking. Will looks around at the wind-and-w vista. Not much of a day for activities.
(sotto) I don't like to fish.
Tyrell moves across the grounds. He looks back. Will is s tracks, looking up at --

head_text.subj: IN THE WINDOW OF THE BELL TOWER --

text: ESTES, staring down at them.
(calling to Will) You coming?
Will trots after him, but he takes a glance back at the w is gone.
Julie has finished on the stairmaster. Both she and Karla after a good workout. Their moods have improved.
Come on, Vampira. I got just the thing for you.
Karla leads Julie over to the tanning beds.
Cancer in a box.
No, this is the safe sun. (joking) It's better than a day at the beach.
Julie is reluctant. KARLA (cont'd) Come on, a little photosynthesis and you'll feel like a new --
Houseplant.
Karla opens the canopy of the tanning bed.
Exactly.
Julie peels off her sweats. Lies down in her underwear. S small pair of GOGGLES. Karla lowers the canopy over Julie.
Karla sets the DIAL. KARLA (cont'd) Set to three seventy-five, bake for one hour...
Karla!
Just kidding.
come to life -- Julie is bathed in purple light.
Tyrell looks across the grounds and sees, at the far end court,

half-obscured by the heavy fooliage surrounding the court Tyrell walks away from Will toward the cart. He hears the the cart playing "TRENCHTOWN ROCK" by Bob Marley..."One g about music...when it hits you feel no pain..."
The open door of the entrance CLANGS against the fence in Tyrell decides to cut through the court to the far entran cart.
Tyrell walks across the court to the sagging net. There is a RUSTLING in the foliage around the court. SOME fast and quietly.
(calling out) Hey, Bong Marley. Come here.

The door SLAMS shut behind him. Tyrell looks back at the door. The latch seems to have st no longer swinging. Tyrell turns back toward the other door and sees The PIT BULL standing in the doorway. Tyrell stares at the dog. The do Tyrell, low and menacing.
I'm gonna kill you, Bong Boy.

Simultaneously, Tyrell turns and the dog lunges forward. Tyrell sprints to the door -- it's LOCKED by a length of into the coupling. He turns to see the dog bounding at him -- Tyrell leaps up the fence just as the pit bull lunges for catches his pant leg. Tyrell kicks him away and frantical up. The dog relentlessly barks and snaps as Tyrell climbs the
looks in at the dog angrily charging the chain-link. He l Tyrell.
Come on. Jump. I've got you.
He reaches out to try and catch Tyrell.
Tyrell finally looses his grip and falls back, landing on He rolls quickly to his feet.
Thanks. (furious) I gotta find me a pool boy.
Karla hammers the bag with a series of quick punches. She stops to catch her breath and hears a THUMPING from the o
Karla sticks her head out the door to the gym, listening. of the hall
is visible, a single BARE BULB lighting the room. Karla m curiously toward it.
Karla slowly sticks her head around the corner just as th NOISE SOUNDS LOUNDLY. She reacts --
in a small laundry room. Karla relaxes.
(doing Julie) Gee, Karla...That'll break the machine...
She approaches the MACHINE, which is rocking with the noi KARLA (cont'd) Damn. How many pairs you got in there?
She opens the dryer door and jumps back.
flies out and into her arms. She looks down a beat, and S murder. A hot spray of blood gushes from the machine.

tumbling inside the dryer. Karla SCREAMS again. Then she SOUND of heavy boots coming down the hall. She runs to th locks it. She's trapped in a bloody basement cell. Suddenly somebod the door. Karla SCREAMS. She runs across the room, shoving a folding table toward BASEMENT WINDOWS. The door is hit again and again. Somebody is throwing the against it. Karla bangs hysterically on the windows, leaving bloody h the panes.
Julie's eyes suddenly open through the GOGGLES. She thumb WALKMAN.
You say something?

Nothing. And just as Julie lies down again, Karla's frant echo down the hall. Julie goes to push open the canopy. As she does, the CANO JAMMED DOWN ON TOP OF HER. A CHAIN shoots through the han is locked on the grill. JULIE (cont'd) Karla! Somebody? Hey, this isn't funny.
Suddenly the lights go off. Julie thrashes around, trying herself.
She sees someone walking around in the room. The person s Julie could almost reach out and touch him. She begins to SCREAM!
Tyrell angrily makes his way past the outdoor pool bar as follows. Tyrell spots a tray of empty bottles. He picks o smashes it in half on the ground. He holds out the jagged Will.
Take this.
And do what with it?
Tyrell breaks another bottle in half.
Julienne of pool boy.
They move toward the nearby POOL HOUSE.
Tyrell and Will stop outside the door. There's MUSIC from Bob Marley -- "Lively Up Yourself..." TYRELL (cont'd) I'm gonna throw the door. Get ready.
Tyrell opens the door and charges in. Will's right behind

They spill into the room. A light fog hangs in the air. T them begin to COUGH and CHOKE. Titus sits on the floor facing away from them, facing a w which gray light pierces the gloom. Titus doesn't move. He's too still. In front of him is a that still SMOKES SLIGHTLY.
Hey, pool boy.
Tyrell closes the distance and kicks Titus in the back. Titus falls over like a block of wood, rictus already set His hands are bound behind him. The cord is tied off to s against the wall.
into the floor, scrabbling for the window and fresh air. Will points out two empty one-gallon PLASTIC BOTTLES.
One is labeled CHLORINE, the other MURIATIC ACID. Will pulls Tyrell from the pool house.
The two of them collapse, COUGHING and CHOKING.
What the -- ?
Will splashes a puddle of rainwater on his face --
That's chlorine and muriatic acid. Put the two together and you get cyanide.
Tyrell rolls over on his back next to Will, practically c lung.
Cyanide? Like poison gas? (reality dawning) You mean, somebody really killed him...Omigod. Think...Think...
Suddenly, they both hear KARLA SCREAMING. They sprint for building.
Tyrell and Will follow Karla's CRIES to a narrow srip of window which runs along the side of the hotel. Her palms one of the windows.
Get back --
Karla ducks down on the table just as the window EXPLODES Tyrell kicks in the pane and looks in. TYRELL (cont'd) Give me your hand!
She reaches for him. He pulls her up and out through the
Karla tumbles to the ground with only one thing to say.
(screaming) Julie!
Tyrell and Will suddenly burst through the door.
Where Julie is just visible, her fingers madly groping fo
Oh, God, get me out. Get me out.
Will struggles to open the bed, but the chain holds stron Tyrell grabs a nearby dumbbell.
Hang on...
Tyrell slams the barbell down, shattering the fiberglass A few of the ultraviolet tubes POP as Will yanks up on th They help Julie up, her eyes adjusting to non-purple ligh
(almost relieved) I'm not crazy...I'm not crazy. He's here... (already moving for the door) We've got to get to the radio and call for help.
I think we can classify this as an emergency situation.
They head for the manager's office.
They burst into the middle of the room before seeing that head has a machete sticking out of it.
Yo, Brooks, listen up -- (reacting) Whoa --
Tyrell, Will, and Karla look at the radio, which is smash floor next to Brooks. Julie stares in shock at the reverse wall, at
with the words "I STILL KNOW" written on it in blood. Karla SCREAMS --
Somebody...is a sick, fingerpainting psycho.
We gotta get out of here. Now.
THE POWER CUTS OUT and the hotel plunges into darkness. Julie SCREAMS and runs from the hotel.
Julie!
Julie runs down the steps and cuts through the blowing pa
Julie is at the end of the dock. Tears are streaming down her chest heaving. The others catch up with her. Karla realizes the boats ar Everyone is freaking out.
There were boats here? Refresh my memory, there were boats...
Tyrell picks up the end of a cut mooring line --
They were cut loose.
Julie? Wanna tell us what is going on here?
They look at Julie. Their escape is cut off by water. The
(freaking out) We're all going to die. He's going to kill us one by one.
Who?
Ben Willis.
(not this again) Oh, stop it! He's dead. You killed him. Now, get over it. We gotta think here.
They never found the body.

Her voice is low and urgent, an impromptu confessional. JULIE (cont'd) Two summers ago. We lied to the authorities. We hit Ben Willis with our car. Ray, me, Barry, and Helen ...We threw the body in the water to cover it up --
Julie...
Only he wasn't dead. He killed Barry and Helen last July Fourth.
Tyrell begins backing away from Julie. He picks up a piec driftwood from the dock. JULIE (cont'd) I thought Ray and I killed him on the boat, but we didn't and now he's back to finish up the job.
Tyrell holds up the log as a weapon. He's angry and afrai
We're on an island, miles from anywhere. I don't give a crap about you're fisherman. There's dead bodies pilling up everywhere and there's one guy missing --
Will moves closer to Tyrell --
The porter...what's his name? Old Asbestos --
Estes! That's exactly who it is. That old guy knows something. We can sit here and wait for him to pick us off or we can go find him first.
Tyrell turns and heads down the dock. Will goes with him. a few hesitant steps after them, then turns back toward J hasn't moved.
Julie, we have to do something.
Julie sees her friend caught in the middle, sees her suff reluctantly starts for Karla --
(sotto) It's not him.

Standard bus folks: old people in Panama hats, buzz-cut m on holiday. Ray sits in a seat. He's in pain and does not look good. He pops a handful of pills into his mouth and washes them Orange Crush -- A dignified OLD LADY has been watching him --
People live healthy in Miami. (sincere, but unsettling) It's the future down there every day of the week...The future.
Ray slumps back, waiting for the pills to work.
I'll keep that in mind.
The door to Estes's room BANGS inward. Tyrell, Will, Karl charge into the room.
Yo, Freak Boy --
The cluttered room is empty.
He's not here.
Tyrell and Will begin roughly searching through Estes's p
We're gonna find some weird crap in here.
In the corner there is a curtain used as a partition. Jul curtain back and discovers

sitting in the corner. It seems to glow from inside while evil pall over the room. Julie moves toward it and hesitates before opening the do Inside -- is a small voodoo shrine. A candle has burned l Hanging before the altar is
impaled on a fishhook.
Voodoo.
I told you.
Julie looks closer. She sees her toothbrush, a hair tie, other knickknacks belonging to her friends.
(to Karla) Missing a hair tie?
Karla looks in. Tyrell snatches the straw man up.
We found our guy.
THUNDER rumbles across the sky like the judgement of God.
Julie, Karla, Tyrell, and Will walk quickly down the corr have grabbed some of their things.
We gotta find flashlights, torches, guns if they got 'em, anything that'll help.
Will and Tyrell eye the stairs leading down to the lobby.
Wait. Maybe he's down there collecting the body parts.
Will and Tyrell exchange a glance, an "are you man enough glance.
Let's go.
The men head into the kitchen and bar area.
We'll only be a second, okay?
Yeah, wait right here, it's the safest place.
Karla is terrified and waits by the stairs, but something Julie's eye. She walks across the lobby.
Julie, where are you going?

Julie keeps walking. She sees historical pictures of the crews during construction; the first limbo contest; fishe next to sailfish and marlin. Near the pictures, Julie sees the globe. It's spinning sl Julie hesitates, then walks toward the globe. It stops sp looks down at it.
and Julie's hand finding Brazil. We see the capital is no Brazilia. This is dawning on Julie when we hear -- ESTES (v.o.) Brasilia.
She jumps out of her skin. Estes was standing right there shadows. ESTES (cont'd) That's the capital of Brazil, not Rio.
Karla SCREAMS. Tyrell comes flying across the lobby past Karla. He dives tackling him to the floor. Will is right behind him.
Let go. I got him. That's me. It's him. We got you...
Leave him alone.
Tyrell holds up battered Estes --
Here's youre killer --
No --
We found your voodoo crap --
No --
They shake Estes, finally giving him a chance to speak. ESTES (cont'd) I found the bodies this morning...I tried to use the radio, but he already destroyed it.
Let him go. I believe him.
Come on, Julie. You saw his room.
I haven't hurt anyone...I stole those things to help you. To protect you.
He's telling the truth. He could've easily killed me. He didn't. (beat while this sinks in) Look, we didn't even answer the radio question right...This whole thing was a setup.
What do you mean?
Rio isn't the capital of Brazil. It was the wrong answer. Sorry, we lose.
(starting to lose it) You've got all these theories but where is he? Where? Where's your fisherman killer?
I don't know.
(losing it) You never do...The guy at the nightclub, the body in your room last night. Little notes that only mean something to you. How do we even know you're not the one behind this --
Estes steps forward --
(to Tyrell) How do we know you're not?
(to Julie) I know who you're talking about. He used to work here at the hotel. (beat) And I've seen him around again. Out in the woods by the orchard.
They look at Estes...Is he telling the truth?
I can't remeber his name, but I don't forget a face. (beseeching) I can show you...
They stare a beat --
How do we know you're not setting us up?
Where else you gonna go, son?
They look to the office, the gym...The sense of death sur them.
I know I don't want to stay in here.
We'll be better off in the open. If we stick together, maybe we can kill this creep for good.
Show us.
They begin moving for the door.

Establish. The rain pounds a fleet of fishing boats. The securely battened down in the weather. Ray limps past, heading for a small building at the end o Its sign reads: Island Ferry, Jack Paulsen -- proprieter.
A gear-strewn office. Paulsen watches an episode of Party There is a loud KNOCKING at the door.
What the...
Paulsen slowly gets up. He cracks the door open. Ray stan silhouetted against the rain.
I need to get to Tower Bay Island.
Paulsen senses something isn't right.
We're closed.
Ray pushes his way in --
I need to get there, now.
Paulsen looks at him standing there drenched.
Did you happen to notice what's going on outside?
Ray pulls out the gun and points it at Paulsen --
I'm not looking for a weather report, I'm looking for a boat. So which one's yours?

Estes, Will, Tyrell, Julie, and Karla walk along a trail heart of the island. The storm has abated for a few minut It's windy, dark, and spooky. The kind of place you'd tak you wanted to scare them with a classic ghost story. That Estes is doing.
He worked here for many years. He had a nice family. A pretty wife and two little ones. A boy and a girl. They'd be about your age, now.
They continue along the path. Estes looks at them in the dark, slowing for just a secon ESTES (cont'd) One day his wife went missing. Maid found blood all over the honeymoon suite -- Room 201.
There are strange NOISES out in the woods. ESTES (cont'd) Eventually, they found her body. Pieces. A leg in the swamp. An arm washed up on Three Mile Beach. (beat) And the head they found much later.
A huge branch is blown from a tree and comes crashing dow underbrush, scaring them. Estes calmly steps around it. ESTES (cont'd) Careful --
(softly) Did he do it?

People say she was running around on him. People say he caught her in bed with other men. People say a lot of things. (beat) He disappeared, taking the two small ones with him. At least they were never found.
The winding path leads to a small orchard. They hang on h word. ESTES (cont'd) We're here.

In the center of the orchard is a cemetery. They move off the path into the safety of the woods. Ther activity around the place. It's silent and eerie. Julie stares, fascinated. She is slowly drawn toward the grabs for her arm.
Be careful, Julie.
I've got to see.
She leads, they follow, circling the house. Julie rounds the shack and stops. She sees --
The first stone reads: SARAH WILLIS (birth/death) The second stone reads: SUSIE WILLIS (birth/death) Beyond them
and the group moves slowly toward it. The headstone, part obscured by the mound of dirt, comes into view. The third headstone reads:
born September 6, 1979 died July 4, 1998 "A Lying Whore"
"A Lying Whore" is scratched with a knife.
(realizing) ...Today's July fourth.
Will goes to comfort Julie --
I'm not dying on this island, Will. (louder) Do you hear me?
Julie shouts into the darkness. JULIE (cont'd) You want me, Ben Willis? Come and get me. I'm right here.
She kicks over her headstone -- JULIE (cont'd) My grave stays empty!
She looks defiantly down the path.
Julie, the boats are gone, the phones are down. There's no way off this place.
Then, we fight --
Will looks around. Estes is gone.
Where'd Estes go?
What is up with that weirdo?
I'll go find him.
Why? He can't help us.
He's probably the only one who can help us.
I'll come with you.
Are you crazy? We're not staying here on our own.
It's okay. He couldn't have gone far. I'll catch up with you later.
Will disappears into the darkness.
Maybe we should just wait here? Hide in a tree?
I'm not hiding up no tree. (to Julie) I'm with her. Let's arm ourselves to the teeth and kick this psycho's butt.

They move cautiously into the kitchen. Blue emergency lig above them. It's a big room with plenty of nooks and cran somebody to be hiding in. Tyrell picks up a couple of different knives. He hefts th hand.
What I need is a gun. Not a steak knife.
Karla grabs a paring knife -- TYRELL (cont'd) You gonna clean vegetables? You gonna stir-fry? You need something that'll get his attention.
He picks up a huge butcher's knife and cuts the air with roughly empties other drawers looking for more weapons. Karla looks to Julie, something on her mind. Julie catche
(hurt) I'm your best friend...You could have told me the truth about what happened. I would've understood.
(sad) Karla, I just wanted the whole thing to be over. I didn't want to involve anybody else.
It's too late for that.
Julie steps over to Karla.
I'm so sorry. I brought this on everyone. It's my fault.
Tyrell picks up on the mood swing. He moves closer to the sympathetic.
Forget that. You didn't do nothing. This fisherman's a piece of scum. (hard for him to admit) I should've been listening to you... I'm sorry.
Julie smiles for a second. TYRELL (cont'd) Now, let's take a look at the pantry.
You think that's a good place to hide?
I don't know, but I'm starving.
Will runs from the trees and finds himself by an old hous Estes by the ocean, near a boat.
Hey Estes. (beat) Estes? Where'd you go?
Estes doesn't answer right away -- he keeps his back to W WILL (cont'd) You abandoning us? How come you didn't tell us you had a boat?
Estes picks up the boat's oar. He speaks low, almost inau
This has to end. Now.
What -- ?
Estes swings the oar, cracking Will's head hard.
Tyrell, Julie, and Karla approach the pantry -- a huge st
Tyrell steps inside.
Steel door...Food...Perfect.

He starts looking for something to eat -- CLANK. There's a soft CLATTERING from somewhere in the ro freezes, staring into the darkness. Tyrell puts a finger to his lips, then creeps down an ais listening. There's nothing but SILENCE. He moves toward the first aisle...He jumps out. The aisle
move down an aisle behind him. Tyrell ducks around to the second aisle. He slices the ai pounce. This aisle is empty.

nervously move another aisle down. Tyrell moves stealthily toward the third aisle...This is forward into the row...Empty, also. There's a small SOUND...A MOUSE scampers off under the sh turns and smiles at Karla and Julie --
It's just a --
bashes him on the back of the head. Tyrell hits the floor unconscious.
Ty!
A DARK FIGURE jumps down from the shelves. Tyrell puts hi
(yelling for mercy) Don't kill me --
Wait, it's Nancy --
Nancy, the bartender steps out of the shadows brandishing pin.
Tyrell stands at the sink, where Karla holds a towel full his head. Nancy, the bartender, looks on apologetically.
I'm sorry, but you could've been the one doing all of this --
And so could you -- crazy fool.
You stumbled into my hiding place.
Must have missed the sign.
Excuse me, but this island didn't have a murder rate until you people showed up. (chilled) I've never seen a dead body before.
Get used to it.
Who's doing this?
(friendly) Don't even get her started...It's a long, long story and you probably wouldn't believe a word of it.

Tyrell moves as he talks, fed up and exhasted. He crosses stove and under a huge hanging rack of pots and pans. TYRELL (cont'd) I mean, all I know for sure is this is the worst vacation of my life... I'm tired, and I'm hungry, and I personally haven't seen one damn psycho killer...
sinks deep into the base of Tyrell's shaved skull, a look surprise on his face. The women freeze as Tyrell dances like a marionette befor hoisted up and hung on the rack like a used saucepan.
is in the vent above the stove. He stares out at them fro his slicker. Ben jumps from the range onto the floor. Karla is in shoc yanks her and they flee. As she goes, Julie picks up
and hides it in her back pocket.
Ray pilots the boat through the dark, choppy water. He's compass, maps spread before him. He sees something off th
drifting on the fast sea. The words "Tower Bay" are paint side. Ray pulls alongside and discovers the boat is empty He reaches for the radio.
(into radio) Come in...This is Summer Breeze requesting emergency assistance for Tower Bay island. I repeat...This is Summer Breeze...
Ray guns the boat away.

Julie, Karla, and Nancy run into the lobby. The storm is outside the front doors. They pause for a second. Behind them we hear the rapid TH of Ben's boots. Nancy goes straight to a desk and pulls out a flashlight. to the main staircase.
I know where we can hide.
The women run up the stairs. Behind them, we hear Ben's F echoing.
On the top floor, they race toward the end of a dark hall At the far end of the hall, Nancy illuminates a section o ceiling.
Give me a boost up --
Julie helps Nancy reach a pull cord in the ceiling.
pulls down. Nancy quickly climbs up.
enters the hallway and continues toward them.
Karla slips, nearly knocking Julie to the floor. They bot upwards -- Ben hits the ladder -- Just as Julie reaches the top rung she SCREAMS --

head_text.subj: BEN'S HOOK IS ON HER FOOT

text: Nancy appears in the opening and throws a brick down at B him in the chest and knocks him back. Julie makes it into the attic. They pull the ladder up be like a drawbridge.
Julie, Karla, and Nancy surround the hatch they've just s fumble with it --
There's no way to lock it.
What do we do?

From below comes LAUGHTER. There's a tug on the hatch, cr open. The girls pull it back shut, but it's hard to get a There's more tugging, the hatch bending down; they can se the rope SNAPS. The hatch slams shut.
There's no way to grip this thing.

Suddenly the STEEL TIP of the HOOK pokes through the crac wriggles around...Turning...And begins to pull the hatch They try to hold it...But it's no use. They let go and ju The attic is lit by a cathedral window. It's crosshatched beams and pink insulation.
Watch your step...
THUNK! Karla's foot goes through a gap between two beams.
dangles through the ceiling.
Julie helps Karla back up onto a beam. NANCY (cont'd) Stay on the beams!

Karla and Julie follow her precarious progress. Ben climbs off the ladder to a beam. He watches them leap beam. His hook glints in the light. Julie, Karla, and Nancy move toward the cathedral window. They are cut off. They spread out against the wall lookin opening to get back to the hatch. Ben feints toward Nancy then swipes at Julie -- He misses. She leaps away. She looks down. Instead of ins sees a
She sees her bed through a one-way mirror. Julie stares, transfixed. Karla is edging her way around the side of Be
(re: the mirror) You'd be amazed by what you'd see. My wife with every man on the island, for example. (to Julie) And you, sexy...I loved watching you.
You sick freak.
Ben suddenly whirls and lunges at Karla. He grabs her, bu lose their balance, teetering for a moment on one of the falling -- They CRASH through the mirror --
Karla and Ben hit the bed in a rain of glass. Karla bounces to her feet and dives out of the way as Ben hook.
Karla backs onto the porch. She backs up against the rail
Julie and Nancy reach the CATHEDRAL WINDOW. They open it
and Ben advancing toward Karla, whose back is against the Karla looks behind her, sees

head_text.subj: THE GLASS ROOF OF THE ORCHID HOUSE

text: which doesn't look nealy strong enough to suppor her. Ben advances, swining the hook. Karla leaps over the rail the glass.

Karla keeps a wary eye on Ben as she gingerly backs up on The GLASS begins CRACKING, subtle crack lines splintering footsteps. Ben lunges and swipes at her with his hook. Karla leans away from the attack and loses her balance, s her back on the glass. She lifts her head. Starts to move...CRACK. The glass is beneath her. She looks through the glass.
She tries to slide toward a support...The glass CREAKS an she moves across the room.
(to herself) Oh, god, no --
She's almost to the support when
taking Karla down into the orchid house.
The roof shatters in an explosion of flying glass. Karla land on her back. She's unconsious --
Julie and Nancy look at the empty space which once was a supporting Karla --
(screaming) Karla!
Ben turns and looks up at Nancy and Julie. Then, he sprin balcony. Julie and Nancy duck back into the attic.
Julie and Nancy climb down into the hallway. They are cau expecting Ben at every turn.
They hurry across the lobby.

A sprawling, steam-filled room, dense with vegetation of shelf after shelf of beautiful orchids. Karla lies unconscious. Slowly, she opens her eyes. There's a rustling in the flowers. She tries to get up, b She waits in terror as
fly up and out of the hole she's made in the roof. Karla tries to stand and her leg gives way. She tests her
Oww...

Karla starts hobbling. She reaches the door -- it's locke other side. There is a thick glass window set in the middle of the do The cranes startle again, something upsetting them. Karla look. Nothing.
Julie and Nancy arrive at the door. Karla pounds on the o points to the lock.
It's locked!
Nancy sees a KEY RING by the door.
It's gotta be one of these.
Nancy tries the first of many keys. Something catches Jul moves in for a closer look. Her eyes go wide --
A powerful BOLT OF LIGHTNING cracks. Fills the room with bright light. BEN IS STANDING INSIDE AND HE'S HEADING STR KARLA.
(terrified) He's inside.
Karla spins. Sees him. Her terrified scream blends with t now SHRIEKING VIOLENTLY.
Please! Hurry!
Nancy fumbles with the keys. Drops them. Julie tries to k
Come on...
Ben closes fast, slicing the tops off orchids as he goes. bud on the tip of his hook. Karla pounds on the door.
(frantic) Hurry!
Nancy fumbles for the right key but the lock is old.
Nancy...
(crying) It's jammed!
The key is stuck.
(through glass) Come on!!
She's running out of time. Julie sees a FIRE AXE encased safety box.
(determined) No way!!
Julie smashes the glass with her elbow. Grabs the axe.
(to Nancy) Move!

Julie hammers the door with the axe. Wood splinters. Glas Ben is almost on top of Karla now. Julie swings. The axe breaks the glass, pulls the frame o drops the axe. They grab Karla. Pull her through. Ben swings. The hook rips Karla's shoe, but Julie and Nan through. Julie and Ben are face to face. Julie has the axe in her stares him down.
Come on, gimme a shot --
Ben rips off his hook, eyeing Julie.
(shouting) Julie, come on.

The slow change in Julie as she realizes... She starts to run. Will roughly grabs her. WILL (cont'd) It's time you woke up, Julie.

Julie's trying to get to the knife she's stashed in her b

Me, me, me. It's always about you. I'm having bad dreams. I can't sleep. I'm not doing well in school. I'm having trouble with my boyfriend.
I trusted you.
We had a connection, didn't we? I can tell you one thing, though. Ray didn't trust me. He was right. He's dead, but he was right.

They come into the orchard. They are covered in mud. Juli again. Goes to her knees. Works the knife free and slashe She slices him across the face. He steps back, feels the blood. WILL (cont'd) What'd you have to do that for?

Why? Come on, Julie. Think. You'll get it. Will Benson -- Ben's son.

OMIGOD --

Ray's finger squeezing down the trigger.

Ben charges toward Ray's back. He pulls back the hook for slashing -- At the last second, Ray dips, elbows Will.

goes straight into Will's chest. The fisherman has hooked his own son. rings out. A look of wonder crosses Ben's face. He slowly from Ray.

stops in the middle of her kamikaze attack, knife held ou

They nod. They go to her -- jubilant group hug time. They themselves. KARLA (cont'd) You know, it's true what they say about package vacations...You get what you pay for. (beat) Now, how about we get off this piece of crap island.

rises into view.
Establish. The sun setting over a quaint street in a coll

Julie pedals her bicycle down the street. She has a book shoulder. It feels like one of the first days of school. She rides the bike up to a small house on the perfect str rolls the bike right up to the front door.

Julie lets herself into the house. She leans her bike aga bike in the hallway. It's a perfect day. Birds CHIRPING. WIND in the willows. another NOISE...from inside her house. She goes perfectly still. And listens. Behind her, by the shadow of a FIGURE moves. She whirls.
She creeps down the hallway toward her kitchen. She pause The dark figure almost knocks into her. She SCREAMS. It's Ray. He's holding a disemboweled toaster.
Ray...what are you doing?
(toaster) Oh...it's not working right. You're home early. (sees she's shaken) Did I scare you?
Never do that again.
(tender) Hey -- I didn't know you were here. It's okay. (beat) We got the refrigerator in. Come see.
She sees the love in his eyes. She hugs him.
I love it here.
It's gonna be great.
Julie climbs to the top of the stairs. She passes Ray in She pauses in the doorway --
Ray is at the sink in boxer shorts. He's using an electri devicice that has just been opened, a gift from the party low WHIRRING sound.
(seeing her) Checking the locks again?
You know me to well.
Julie smile and walks to the bedroom.

Julie climbs into bed with a book. The bedroom is clean a The windows are closed. The closet door is shut. The room is decorated simply: a high antique bed; unopene highboy; an antique mirror leaning against the wall. A st sits in a chair. There is a CLATTER from another room. Julie freezes. She hears it again. She climbs out of bed.

Julie walks into the dark spare bedroom. The CLATTERING S from the open window. The wind is blowing the blinds. Julie relaxes. She shuts the window. As she leaves the ro the dirty imprint of a boot below the window.
Julie passes Ray who is still absorbed with the new toy. Behind him, the door softly closes. The lock twists. Ray happy being the dental-hygene pacesetter of the household

She looks around the room.
What is my problem?

She sits down on the bed. We see her bare feet from under the bed. She smiles, relaxes. She looks in the mirror leaning agai Something has caught her eye. She freezes. She turns slow the reflection in the mirror. She sees the glint of steel

head_text.subj: THE FISHERMAN CROUCHING UNDER HER BED

text: Julie turns too late -- The fisherman lunges out and grabs her legs. Julie scream down -- Her nails scrape into the wooden floor as she is dragged bed.
